newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq slightly higher, Staples down.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq slightly higher, Staples down.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks closed slightly higher on Wednesday with action focusing on Staples Inc and its planned acquisition of Office Depot Inc.
The Nasdaq Composite Index was up 1.52, or 0.13 percent, at 1143.81 at its unofficial close while advancers led decliners 2030 to 1945 on volume of about 443 million shares.
The most actively traded Nasdaq issue was Staples down 3/4 at 18-3/4. The company said it was buying Office Depot Inc Office Depot shares rose 4-5/8 to 20-3/8 and topped the NYSE most active list.
Shares of Matrix Pharmaceuticals Inc were down 3-1/2 at 7-7/8 after Cowen & Co said it cut its rating on the company to buy from strong buy and reduced its 1997 and 1998 earnings per share estimates.
3Com Corp was up 1-1/4 at 48-1/8 after SoundView Financial raised its short-term rating on the stock to buy from hold. SoundView kept its long-term buy rating.
Intuit Inc was down 3-3/4 at 32-1/2. Morgan Stanley cut its 1997 earnings per share view on the company.
